dorks.name: Find Sensitive Config Files
dorks.description: Searches for potentially sensitive configuration or environment files.
dorks.dork: site:$target.com$ ext:xml | ext:conf | ext:cnf | ext:reg | ext:inf | ext:rdp | ext:cfg | ext:txt | ext:ora | ext:ini | ext:env
dorks.notes: Look for files like .env which might contain database passwords or API keys.

variations.label: Focus on .env files
variations.find: ext:xml | ext:conf | ext:cnf | ext:reg | ext:inf | ext:rdp | ext:cfg | ext:txt | ext:ora | ext:ini | ext:env

dorks.name: Find Public Log Files
dorks.description: Searches for publicly exposed log files which can contain sensitive information.
dorks.notes: Log files can reveal user activity, errors, IP addresses, and application paths.

dorks.name: Find Exposed Database Files
dorks.description: Hunts for publicly exposed database files.
dorks.notes: These files can contain full database dumps, including user data and passwords.

dorks.name: Find Public Backup Files
dorks.description: Searches for common backup file extensions on a target domain.
dorks.dork: site:$target.com$ ext:bkf | ext:bkp | ext:bak | ext:old | ext:backup | ext:zip | ext:tar.gz
dorks.notes: Try looking for specific filenames like 'backup.zip' or 'site.tar.gz'.

dorks.name: Discover Login Pages
dorks.description: Attempts to find login portals on the target domain.
dorks.dork: site:$target.com$ inurl:login | inurl:signin | intitle:"Sign In" | intitle:Login | inurl:auth
dorks.notes: This can reveal non-standard login pages for different services.

dorks.name: Discover Admin Panels
dorks.description: Attempts to find administrative control panels.

dorks.name: Find Open Directory Listings
dorks.description: Finds servers with directory listing enabled, which can expose files.
dorks.notes: This is a classic misconfiguration. Look for interesting parent directories like '/backups' or '/uploads'.

dorks.name: Find Exposed Git Repositories
dorks.description: Finds exposed .git folders on web servers, which can leak source code.
dorks.notes: If found, you can use tools like 'git-dumper' to download the entire repository.

dorks.name: Subdomain Enumeration
dorks.description: Uses Google to find subdomains belonging to a target domain.
dorks.notes: This can uncover forgotten or internal applications like 'dev.*', 'staging.*', 'vpn.*', etc.

dorks.name: Find Files with Keywords
dorks.description: Searches for specific file types on a target domain containing sensitive keywords.
dorks.notes: Use keywords like 'password', 'internal', 'confidential', 'private', or 'minutes'.

dorks.name: Find API Documentation
dorks.description: Discovers API documentation pages like Swagger or OpenAPI.
dorks.dork: site:$target.com$ inurl:swagger | inurl:api-docs | inurl:openapi | intitle:"Swagger UI"
dorks.notes: Exposed API docs can reveal all available endpoints, parameters, and expected data structures.

dorks.name: Find Postman Collections
dorks.description: Looks for publicly shared Postman collections related to a target.
dorks.notes: Developers sometimes accidentally make their API collections public.

dorks.name: Find API Endpoints in JS Files
dorks.description: Scans JavaScript files for common API paths and endpoints.
dorks.notes: Frontend JavaScript often contains hardcoded API endpoints. Search for common patterns.

dorks.name: Discover GraphQL Endpoints
dorks.description: Searches for common GraphQL development interface URLs.
dorks.notes: If introspection is enabled, you can query the entire schema from these endpoints.

dorks.name: Find API Keys in Code Repos
dorks.description: Searches public code repositories like GitHub for API keys associated with a target.
dorks.notes: Be specific with your target domain to reduce false positives. This can uncover hardcoded credentials.

dorks.name: Find Social Media Profiles
dorks.description: Finds social media profiles for a specific person.
dorks.notes: Try adding a location or company to the person's name to narrow results.

dorks.name: Find Resumes and CVs
dorks.description: Searches for resumes or CVs associated with a person's name.
dorks.notes: This can reveal contact information, work history, and skills.

dorks.name: Find Email Addresses
dorks.description: Tries to discover email addresses for a person at a specific company.
dorks.notes: Also try searching for common email patterns like 'firstname.lastname@company.com'.

dorks.name: General Search by Email
dorks.description: Searches across the web for any mention of a specific email address.
dorks.notes: This can uncover forum posts, account registrations, and document metadata where the email was used.

dorks.name: Username Search
dorks.description: Finds accounts on major platforms associated with a specific username.
dorks.notes: Useful for tracking a person's digital footprint across different services.

dorks.name: Find Public Docs by Author
dorks.description: Searches for PDF files where a person is listed as the author.
dorks.notes: Great for finding research papers, official reports, or other publications.
